title: Watch: Fraser Minten scores game-sealing goal for Bruins against his former team
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Fraser Minten scored an insurance goal for the Bruins in a 5-3 win against the Toronto Maple Leafs.
Minten was originally part of the Maple Leafs before being traded to Boston last season for Brandon Carlo.
The goal marked Minten's third of the season and helped the Bruins secure their sixth straight victory.

title: Bruins legend Zdeno Chara describes ‘surreal’ induction into Hockey Hall of Fame
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Zdeno Chara was formally inducted into the Hockey Hall of Fame on Saturday, receiving a ring and plaque in Toronto.
Chara shared the event with fellow inductee and former Bruin Joe Thornton during the induction festivities in Toronto.
Chara, a Stanley Cup champion and seven-time All-Star, captained the Boston Bruins for 14 years from 2006.

title: What insiders are predicting for the Red Sox in free agency this offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Red Sox are predicted to be active in free agency, targeting top players like Alex Bregman and Kyle Schwarber.
Boston has approximately $25 million before the first luxury tax threshold, allowing room for potential significant signings.
MLB insiders list Bregman, Schwarber, Alonso, Murakami, Cease, and Valdez as potential targets for the Red Sox.

title: Review & setlist: John Legend was a legendary pro at MGM Fenway (and he knew it)
author: Marc Hirsh
bullets: John Legend performed at MGM Music Hall at Fenway on November 7, 2025, marking 20 years since his debut album.
The setlist included songs from Legend's debut album 'Get Lifted' as well as covers from artists like The Beatles and Kanye West.
Legend's performance showcased his versatility with a mix of gospel, R&B, and pop, featuring both original songs and varied covers.

title: Jaylen Brown seemingly criticizes officiating again following Celtics’ loss to Magic
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jaylen Brown criticized officiating again following the Celtics' 123-110 loss to the Magic.
Brown's previous criticism of referees came after a 105-103 loss to the Jazz, citing a missed foul call.
During the recent game against the Magic, Brown scored 32 points but struggled in the fourth quarter.

title: 5 things to know about Buccaneers ahead of Sunday’s game vs. Patriots
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Patriots face the Buccaneers, both division leaders, in Week 10 with Tampa Bay holding a 6-2 record.
Buccaneers quarterback Baker Mayfield is an MVP candidate, leading the NFL with eight deep pass touchdowns this season.
Tampa Bay's defense ranks seventh in DVOA, led by standout players Vita Vea, Jamel Dean, and Antoine Winfield Jr.

title: Patriots’ return to relevance includes appearance by Jim Nantz in TV booth to call game for CBS
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Jim Nantz and Tony Romo will call the Patriots-Buccaneers game for CBS, the first Patriots game they've covered since 2023.
CBS reassigned Nantz and Romo to the game due to Miami's poor season, replacing an expected Dolphins-Bills matchup.
This game signifies a resurgence for the Patriots, led by quarterback Drake Maye and coach Mike Vrabel.

title: Magic pull away, beat Celtics despite another big Jaylen Brown game: 8 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: The Boston Celtics lost 123-110 to the Orlando Magic, marking their first defeat in the NBA Cup series.
Jaylen Brown scored 32 points on 15-for-28 shooting, continuing his strong performance streak for the Celtics.
Orlando Magic outperformed Celtics in 3-point shooting, making 17 of 36, whereas Celtics struggled from deep.

title: Public reprimand recommended for judge accused of helping immigrant escape ICE
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Judge Shelley Joseph recommended for public reprimand for creating appearance of impropriety during a 2018 ICE incident.
Massachusetts hearing officer found insufficient evidence that Joseph authorized an immigrant's escape from court custody.
Federal obstruction charges against Joseph were dropped in 2022; she referred herself for a state misconduct investigation.

title: Alex Cora still high on Red Sox’ future a month after being eliminated by Yankees
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Red Sox lost to Yankees in American League Wild Card Series, ending their 2025 postseason run.
Alex Cora expresses optimism about Red Sox's future despite roster changes and postseason exit.
Trevor Story opted in, while Alex Bregman opted out amid potential Red Sox offseason trades.
